intro: Vincetoxicum canescens, commonly known as the white milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant is native to regions of Europe and Asia and thrives in dry, sandy or rocky soils. Its fruit is a legume pod that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Vincetoxicum canescens is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands.
